Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate ways that dance works, performers and/or choreographers across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts use the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or production elements to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: analysing dances from a range of times and locations, such as dances from times they are studying in History or dance from a country or region in Asia, and considering how a single realistic movement can be manipulated from representational to symbolic (literal to abstract)

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate ways that dance works, performers and/or choreographers across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts use the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or production elements to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: investigating the development of dance styles in different artistic, social, environmental, historical or cultural contexts; for example, identifying the distinguishing stylistic features of dances in a range of styles or from a range of times or places, and considering how these can inform their choreography

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate ways that dance works, performers and/or choreographers across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts use the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or production elements to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: using Viewpoints to explore questions such as “What was the choreographer’s intention for this dance?”, “What ideas did you think the dance expressed?”

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate ways that dance works, performers and/or choreographers across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts use the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or production elements to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: comparing use of one or more elements of dance and/or choreographic devices such as repetition in dances from a range of genres/styles, cultures, times and/or places; for example, dances from a range of cultures or countries in Asia

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate ways that dance works, performers and/or choreographers across cultures, times, places and/or other contexts use the elements of dance, choreographic devices and/or production elements to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: investigating how digital tools and use of immersive technologies such as virtual reality (VR) are influencing choreography, performance or use of production elements

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate the diversity of dance choreographed and/or performed by First Nations Australians considering culturally responsive approaches to Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights
Elaboration: exploring information about Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights that is available to help dance practitioners understand how to make ethical choices; for example, asking questions such as “Who created this dance or these movements?”

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate the diversity of dance choreographed and/or performed by First Nations Australians considering culturally responsive approaches to Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights
Elaboration: using and annotating a map of First Nations Australian language groups to identify where First Nations Australian choreographers and/or performers are working and provide short descriptions of the dance they are choreographing and/or performing

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate the diversity of dance choreographed and/or performed by First Nations Australians considering culturally responsive approaches to Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights
Elaboration: analysing how linear and non-linear narrative is used in specific examples of dance choreographed and/or performed by First Nations Australians to explore issues such as relationships, identity or empathy

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: investigate the diversity of dance choreographed and/or performed by First Nations Australians considering culturally responsive approaches to Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights
Elaboration: investigating an example of cultural appropriation where it has been found that First Nations Australian Indigenous Cultural and Intellectual Property rights have been denied and identifying how this situation could have been approached respectfully; for example, a situation where a choreographer has used movement vocabulary that carries cultural knowledge without permission from the knowledge holders

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: develop safe dance practice and use of expressive and technical skills and, as appropriate, genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: developing dance skills and style-specific techniques; for example, experimenting to extend their own movement vocabulary by improvising using movements and techniques from diverse dance styles

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: develop safe dance practice and use of expressive and technical skills and, as appropriate, genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: exploring how expressive skills can be used to communicate ideas; for example, using gesture or facial expression to communicate relationships or emotions

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: develop safe dance practice and use of expressive and technical skills and, as appropriate, genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: extending technical competence such as control, coordination, accuracy, alignment, balance, flexibility, strength, endurance and articulation when moving, in response to self, peer and/or teacher feedback

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: reflect on own and others’ dance works and/or practices to inform choreographic choices and use of technical and expressive skills
Elaboration: reflecting on how they have used or extended their movement vocabulary and considering options for further development

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: reflect on own and others’ dance works and/or practices to inform choreographic choices and use of technical and expressive skills
Elaboration: evaluating influences on their own performance or choreography; for example, using a journal to document interesting examples of how others use an element of dance or genre- or style-specific techniques, and considering how to use these ideas in their own choreography or performance

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: reflect on own and others’ dance works and/or practices to inform choreographic choices and use of technical and expressive skills
Elaboration: reflecting on feedback from peers who have observed a workshop or a rehearsal and using ideas from the feedback/reflection to refine dance; for example, use of technical and expressive skills or a choreographic device

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: choreograph dance by selecting and manipulating elements of dance and choreographic devices to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: exploring ways to use elements of dance and choreographic devices to portray characters and stories respectfully and empathetically

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: choreograph dance by selecting and manipulating elements of dance and choreographic devices to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: experimenting with ways to use the elements of dance and choreographic devices to represent ideas about themes or issues such as social relationships through dance; for example, through improvisation

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: choreograph dance by selecting and manipulating elements of dance and choreographic devices to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: selecting movements from an improvisation, such as an improvisation focusing on communication of mood or emotion, and organising it for use in a music video or as short phrases that participants in an immersive experience such as VR can use

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: choreograph dance by selecting and manipulating elements of dance and choreographic devices to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: selecting, combining, refining and sequencing movement using choreographic devices such as transitions, variation and contrast, and choreographic forms such as binary, ternary and narrative

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: choreograph dance by selecting and manipulating elements of dance and choreographic devices to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: analysing and evaluating the structural choices made in their dance by documenting their process in records such as journals, blogs, video or audio recordings, securing permission where appropriate

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: apply technical and expressive skills and/or genre- or style-specific techniques to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: applying technical skills such as strength, balance or coordination to intensify communication of mood/atmosphere in a dance they are choreographing and/or performing

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: apply technical and expressive skills and/or genre- or style-specific techniques to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: responding to feedback to enhance communication of choreographic intent to the audience; for example, by refining use of technical skills such as accuracy or flexibility

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: apply technical and expressive skills and/or genre- or style-specific techniques to communicate ideas, perspectives and/or meaning
Elaboration: using questions based on Viewpoints to evaluate clarity of movement, projection, focus and musicality when preparing for a performance, and using video to evaluate and refine spatial placement or articulation

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: rehearse and perform dance for audiences, using technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: planning effective use of available performance spaces during rehearsals

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: rehearse and perform dance for audiences, using technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: using production elements such as projection, soundscape, music, special effects or voice-overs to share key ideas or information about the creative intention of the dance with the audience

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: rehearse and perform dance for audiences, using technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: using technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate, genre- or style-specific techniques when performing dance they have learnt and/or choreographed

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: rehearse and perform dance for audiences, using technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: using rehearsal strategies or techniques such as spotting to enhance confidence, clarity of movement, projection, focus and musicality in performance

Subject: Dance
ContentDescription: rehearse and perform dance for audiences, using technical and expressive skills and, as appropriate genre- or style-specific techniques
Elaboration: introducing their dance to an audience; for example, in a program note or voice-over that uses descriptive style-specific dance terminology
